Q: What are common web application security vulnerabilities?
A: Common web application security vulnerabilities include:
1. SQL Injection (SQLi)
2. Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
3. Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
4. Broken Authentication
5. Security Misconfiguration
6. Sensitive Data Exposure
7. XML External Entity (XXE)
8. Broken Access Control
9. Insecure Deserialization
10. Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities

Q: How can you prevent SQL injection attacks?
A: To prevent SQL injection attacks:
1. Use Parameterized Queries
2. Input Validation and Sanitization
3. Escape Special Characters
4. Use ORMs (Object-Relational Mapping)
5. Principle of Least Privilege
6. Regular Security Testing
7. Use Stored Procedures
8. Keep Software Updated
9. Use Web Application Firewalls
10. Implement Error Handling
